result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CLAYTON E THUNDER

defendant.name: THUNDER, CLAYTON E

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER in court.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wants to waive his right to an attoney for right now because he has been waiting for months.  Judge reviews all cases and all charges and the maximum penalties facing the defendant.  Defendant is unsure if he can represent himself; therefore Judge is not able to allow him to waive his right to an attorney at this time.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Eligible for SPD services

2:34 PM Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with.  Public defender office still looking for counsel.  Defendant wants to represent himself.  Court sets new date for attorney waiver review.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:40 PM. Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on if he wishes to hold his PH today or waive the time limits until he an atty. is appointed to his case. Defendant asks the Court for some clarification. Defendant waives the time limits for holding the PH. Court accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  Have Law enforcement standby while removing belongings.
